lst.name: sentence
lst.str: China has said there will be no major price reforms this year following widespread discontent in 1985 and 1986 from a public used to stable prices since the Communist takeover in 1949.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: China's position, as set out in a memorandum to GATT in February, is that it is gradually reforming its price system to bring prices in line with real production costs and replace administrative controls with market ones.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: However, China would not apply for membership on similar terms, but rather as a less developed country entitled to preferential treatment.
